00174       // Returns a pointer to an iterator that iterates over the
00175       // set of all vertices in this mesh.  The calling code should
00176       // delete the returned iterator when it is finished with it.
00177       // If vertices are added or removed from the Mesh after obtaining
00178       // an iterator, the behavior of that iterator is undefined.
00179     virtual VertexIterator* vertex_iterator(MsqError &err);
00180     
00181       // Returns a pointer to an iterator that iterates over the
00182       // set of all top-level elements in this mesh.  The calling code should
00183       // delete the returned iterator when it is finished with it.
00184       // If elements are added or removed from the Mesh after obtaining
00185       // an iterator, the behavior of that iterator is undefined.
00186     virtual ElementIterator* element_iterator(MsqError &err);

00218       // Each vertex has a byte-sized flag that can be used to store
00219       // flags.  This byte's value is neither set nor used by the mesh
00220       // implementation.  It is intended to be used by Mesquite algorithms.
00221       // Until a vertex's byte has been explicitly set, its value is 0.
00222     virtual void vertex_set_byte (VertexHandle vertex,
00223                                   unsigned char byte,
00224                                   MsqError &err);

00226                                     const unsigned char *byte_array,
00227                                     size_t array_size,
00228                                     MsqError &err);

00415       // Instead of deleting a Mesh when you think you are done,
00416       // call release().  In simple cases, the implementation could
00417       // just call the destructor.  More sophisticated implementations
00418       // may want to keep the Mesh object to live longer than Mesquite
00419       // is using it.
00420     virtual void release();
